choices.text:
write a python function to read from a spreadsheet
Here is an example of how you could write a Python function to read data from a Google Sheets spreadsheet using the gspread library:
```python
import gspread
from oauth2client.service_account import ServiceAccountCredentials

def get_data(file_id):
    # Set up credentials and authenticate with Google Drive
    creds = ServiceAccountCredentials(
        "YOUR_CLIENT_ID.apps.googleusercontent.com",
        "YOUR_SECRET_KEY"
    )
    gspread.authorize(creds)

    # Get the spreadsheet using its ID
    sheet = gspread.get(file_id).worksheets()[0]

    # Read data from a specific range of cells in the first row (assuming A1 is the first column)
    values = [row[0].values for row in sheet.col_values[0]]

    return values
```
